name: Summer Calabacitas Tacos
description: I make these tacos once a week in summer. They are super easy to make and they utilize all the wonderful summer produce available at the local farmer's market.
recipeIngredient: ¼ cup Vegetable stock or water

recipeInstructions.text: In a large heavy bottomed pot, set to medium heat; sweat the onion in 1/4 cup of vegetable broth for 2 to 3 minutes until onion is translucent.
recipeInstructions.name: In a large heavy bottomed pot, set to medium heat; sweat the onion in 1/4 cup of vegetable broth for 2 to 3 minutes until onion is translucent.

recipeInstructions.text: Add corn and garlic and pour in remaining ¼ cup of vegetable broth, cover and let steam until corn is tender, about 3 – 4 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: Add corn and garlic and pour in remaining ¼ cup of vegetable broth, cover and let steam until corn is tender, about 3 – 4 minutes.

recipeInstructions.text: Uncover, add zucchini and cook for 3-4 minutes, until it begins to soften.
recipeInstructions.name: Uncover, add zucchini and cook for 3-4 minutes, until it begins to soften.

recipeInstructions.text: Add tomato and cook for 5 minutes more, or until all the vegetables are tender.
recipeInstructions.name: Add tomato and cook for 5 minutes more, or until all the vegetables are tender.

recipeInstructions.text: Season to taste, and serve on warm tortillas with avocado slices and salsa.
recipeInstructions.name: Season to taste, and serve on warm tortillas with avocado slices and salsa.

keywords: summer tacos, vegan tacos, vegetable tacos, vegetarian tacos
